repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The Tiruppukaḻ is a collection of hymns in honour of Murukaṉ by Aruṇakirinātar (15th century).
The bundle is complete. It contains 5 Pāyiram stanzas and 164 Tiruppukāls.
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, title-page, preface folio (Ciṟappupāyiram), colophon.

supportDesc.condition: Very good state of preservation, in spite of bore holes caused by insects.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page. No foliation. Double folio. Verso blank.
1 folio = Tiruppukaḻ: Preface (Ciṟappuppāyiram in print editions). No foliation.
70 folios = Tiruppukaḻ: Mūlam. Tamil foliation 1-70. 5 to 6 lines per page.
1 folio = Colophon. No foliation. Verso blank.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Double leaf.

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 49.
Rosny, Léon de (1868). La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
